intro: Sinistrophorum, commonly known as the left-handed orchid, is a rare and enigmatic genus of flowering plants. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and growth habits. The plant typically features delicate, pendulous flowers with a distinctive asymmetrical morphology. Sinistrophorum is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
